numbered_ace_sentences: 1. I noticed that more people who are 15-24 years old said that the world is getting better with each generation.
2. I noticed that fewer people who are 40+ years old said that the world is getting better with each generation.
3. I noticed that many different countries participated in this survey.
4. These countries have different economic statuses.
5. These countries have different social statuses.
6. These countries have different political statuses.
7. I wonder how much the graph would change if every country in the world was included.
8. I wonder whether economic status affected these results.
9. Indonesia had the highest result.
10. I wonder what the reason was for Indonesia having the highest result.
11. Mali had the lowest result.
12. I wonder what the reason was for Mali having the lowest result.
13. I wonder what the reason was for young adults believing that the world is getting better with each generation.
14. This relates to me and my community.
15. My age group is included in this graph.
16. It is interesting that the 15-24 age group is more optimistic than the 40+ age group.
17. The graph depicts people who are 15-24 years old and people who are 40+ years old.
18. The graph depicts how these people responded to a question.
19. The question is whether the world is becoming better with each generation.
20. The question is whether the world is becoming worse with each generation.
21. The headline is: How optimistic is your generation?
